intro: Gutzlaffia aprica var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are smooth and glossy, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
